story.storybody:
Jamshedpur, Jun 1 (PTI) Train services between Tatanagar and Kharagpur stations on the Howrah-Mumbai main line was affected after two wheels of a goods train derailed near Ghatsila station under Kharagpur Division of South Eastern Railway today, Railway officials said.

The derailment occurred when the goods train was returning to the yard after unloading at the Hindustan Copper Limited shed in Ghatsila, officials said.

Long distance express trains including Puri-Haridwar Express and Utkal Express were stranded at different stations due to the derailment, they said.

Senior Divisional Commercial Manager (Chakradharpur Division), Satyam Prakash said the derailment had affected normal train running on the Howrah-Mumbai route.

All major trains including Howrah-Pune Azad Hind Express, Howrah-Mumbai Mail and others were likely to be affected due to the derailment, officials said. PTI BS DKB
story.shortheadline: Goods train derails, Hwh-Mum main line Rly services affected
